title: The Castellows
text:
The Castellows are an American neotraditional country music trio consisting of sisters Eleanor, Lily, and Powell Balkcom. Eleanor and Powell are two of triplets. Lily is their younger sister, about eighteen months junior. Born in Georgetown, Quitman County, Georgia, the sisters moved to Nashville in 2023 and signed a record deal with Warner Music Nashville and Warner Records. Their first EP, A Little Goes a Long Way, was released on February 9, 2024.  Castellow was their great-grandmother's maiden name.


== Career ==
The Castellows began attracting attention in 2022 through posting cover song performances to their Instagram and TikTok accounts. In January 2023, the group caught interest from insiders in the music industry. The sisters had not considered a career in music until March of that year. By the Spring, the trio had received interest from the industry nationwide. In October, they signed a record deal with Warner Music Nashville and Warner Records, and released their debut single "No. 7 Road".  This was followed by a cover of Leon Everette's "Hurricane" in November, and "I Know It'll Never End" in January 2024. Their debut EP, titled A Little Goes a Long Way and produced by Trina Shoemaker, was released on February 9. The song "I Know It Will Never End" was nominated for the CMT digital-first performance of the year, at the 2024 CMT Music Awards.


== Members ==
Eleanor "Ellie" Balkcom – acoustic guitar, backing vocals
Lily Balkcom – lead vocals, acoustic guitar, bass guitar
Powell Balkcom – banjo, backing vocals
Touring Members

Justin Maynard − backing fiddle, guitar
